scenario: You want to ask your boss for more money.
why_short: It doesn't say how much money or why you deserve it.
improved_prompt: Write a polite email asking for a 10% raise because I did a good job on the big project.

scenario: You are writing an ad for new headphones.
why_short: It doesn't say who will buy them or what features to talk about.
improved_prompt: Write an exciting ad for college students about the X-200 headphones and their long battery life.

scenario: You want to summarize a news article.
why_short: It doesn't say how long the summary should be.
improved_prompt: Summarize this article for students in one paragraph of 200 words.

scenario: You need a chocolate cake recipe.
why_short: It doesn't say how big the cake should be or how hard it is to make.
improved_prompt: Give me an easy gluten-free chocolate cake recipe for 8 people.

scenario: You are writing a welcome email for a newsletter.
why_short: It doesn't tell the new readers what to do next.
improved_prompt: Write a friendly welcome email that asks subscribers to reply with their favorite plant.

scenario: You need to tell your team about a new work rule.
why_short: It doesn't try to make the team feel good about the change.
improved_prompt: Write a nice note about the new work policy that focuses on the benefits of seeing each other.

scenario: You need a study schedule.
why_short: It clearly lists the subjects, times, and days nicely.
improved_prompt: Create a 2-week study plan for the SATs covering Math and English, assigning 1 hour per subject each weekday and a practice test on Saturdays.

scenario: You want to fix a slow script.
why_short: It asks for exactly what is needed and nothing else.
improved_prompt: Review the attached Python script for efficiency errors only, ignoring style guide violations, and provide the top 3 optimizations.

scenario: You want an AI to check your math.
why_short: The AI can't check the answer without seeing the problem first.
improved_prompt: Here is the problem: '2x + 5 = 15'. My answer is 5. Is that right?

scenario: You want feedback on an email draft.
why_short: The AI doesn't know what the email says or who it is for.
improved_prompt: I am writing to my team about a deadline. Does this draft sound polite? [Insert Draft]

scenario: You want code to give grades.
why_short: 'Standard rules' are different everywhere.
improved_prompt: Write a Python function to grade scores: A is 90-100, B is 80-89, C is 70-79.

scenario: You want to change a recipe size.
why_short: It doesn't say how many people you want to feed.
improved_prompt: Change this pancake recipe to feed 10 people instead of 4: [Insert Recipe]

scenario: You want an intro for a travel blog.
why_short: It doesn't say where you went or what was special.
improved_prompt: Write a blog intro about my solo trip to Japan and its amazing food.

scenario: You are planning a weekend trip.
why_short: It doesn't say what you like to do or how much money to spend.
improved_prompt: Plan a 3-day NYC trip for a couple who loves art and Italian food, with a medium budget.

scenario: You need to organize data.
why_short: It gives the data and tells exactly how to organize it.
improved_prompt: Parse this raw CSV string 'Name,Role;Sarah,Editor;Tom,Writer' into a JSON list of objects with 'name' and 'role' keys.

scenario: You are explaining a game to kids.
why_short: It says who the kids are and where they are playing.
improved_prompt: Explain the rules of 'Capture the Flag' to a group of 10-year-olds using simple language, assuming they play outdoors.

scenario: You want a short summary of a long book.
why_short: You can't fit a big book summary into just 10 words.
improved_prompt: Summarize the main idea of 'War and Peace' in one sentence under 20 words.

scenario: You want to play a game.
why_short: The game has no rules or setting yet.
improved_prompt: Let's play a game set in a haunted house. I am a detective. You describe the room.

scenario: You need to answer an angry customer.
why_short: It doesn't say to be nice or sorry.
improved_prompt: Write a polite email to a customer about their late order and offer a discount.

scenario: You need a coffee slogan.
why_short: It asks for too many things in just 3 words.
improved_prompt: Write a rhyming coffee slogan about morning energy that is under 6 words long.

scenario: You want a workout plan.
why_short: It doesn't say if you have gym gear or are fit.
improved_prompt: Give me a 30-minute workout plan for beginners with no equipment.

scenario: You need a movie for family night.
why_short: It doesn't say the age rating or what kind of movie.
improved_prompt: Recommend 3 animated adventure movies rated PG for 7-year-olds.

scenario: You need a safe password.
why_short: It gives all the rules for length and characters.
improved_prompt: Generate a random password that is 16 characters long, includes keys symbols, numbers, and uppercase letters, but no repeating characters.

scenario: You are saying no to a wedding.
why_short: It explicitly says to be polite and gives the reason.
improved_prompt: Write a polite note declining a wedding invitation because I will be out of the country on that date.

scenario: You need a grocery list.
why_short: It doesn't say if it should be a list or a paragraph.
improved_prompt: Give me a bulleted list of 10 healthy snacks, grouped by food type.

scenario: You want to sort user feedback.
why_short: It doesn't say what columns or headers to use.
improved_prompt: Organize this feedback into a table with columns: 'Name', 'Issue', 'Mood', and 'Fix'.

scenario: You want to get data for an app.
why_short: It asks for JSON but doesn't list the keys.
improved_prompt: Extract names and numbers into a JSON list with 'name' and 'phone' keys.

scenario: You want to compare two phones.
why_short: A table is better than text for comparing things.
improved_prompt: Make a comparison table for the iPhone 15 and Samsung S24 showing Price, Battery, and Screen.

scenario: You are writing a poem.
why_short: A spreadsheet file (CSV) is a bad shape for a poem.
improved_prompt: Write a poem about the ocean with three stanzas of 4 lines each.

scenario: You need notes from a meeting.
why_short: It needs headers to be easy to read.
improved_prompt: Summarize this meeting into notes with headers: 'Who was there', 'What we said', and 'What to do next'.

scenario: You are changing units in a recipe.
why_short: It asks for a specific table with exact columns.
improved_prompt: Convert this recipe's measurements to metric and output as a Markdown table with columns: 'Ingredient', 'Metric Amount', 'Original Amount'.

scenario: You want comments for code.
why_short: It says exactly which style guide to follow.
improved_prompt: Add Python docstrings to each function in the attached code, following the Google Docstring Style Guide.
